block.p: Keri Ann Law, the daughter of Florence and Richard Law of Manhasset, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Joseph A. Sack, the son of Randi Sack and Joseph W. Sack of Briarcliff Manor, N.Y. The Rev. Joseph Parkes performed the ceremony at St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church.
The couple graduated from the College of the Holy Cross in Worcester, Mass., and received law degrees from Fordham University, though they did not meet in either place.

Keri Ann Law, the daughter of Florence and Richard Law of Manhasset, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Joseph A. Sack, the son of Randi Sack and Joseph W. Sack of Briarcliff Manor, N.Y. The Rev. Joseph Parkes performed the ceremony at St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church.
The couple graduated from the College of the Holy Cross in Worcester, Mass., and received law degrees from Fordham University, though they did not meet in either place.

The bride, 30, will continue to use her name professionally. She is an associate at Kramer Levin Naftalis & Frankel, a law firm in Manhattan. She is also an adjunct professor at Fordham Law School. Her father works in Manhattan as a consultant on manufacturing and packaging to the recording industry. Her mother teaches kindergarten at Public School 21 in Flushing, Queens.

The bridegroom, 32, is a senior special counsel in the enforcement division of the New York Stock Exchange. His mother teaches the first grade at George Washington Elementary School in White Plains. His father is the senior vice president for e-commerce at the Bond Market Association, a trade group in Manhattan.
